title: Update regarding Quantum Compute
story_body:
Quantum Compute Inc. (QNTM) is among several technology companies affected by industry-wide shortages in critical components, disrupting supply chains across the sector.

As of 08:00 EST, industry reports indicate that QNTM, a leading developer of quantum computing hardware and software, is experiencing delays in the delivery of essential components, including high-performance semiconductors and advanced memory chips.

The shortages, which began to manifest in late Q4 2022, are attributed to a combination of factors, including increased demand from the burgeoning cloud computing and artificial intelligence markets, as well as manufacturing capacity constraints among key suppliers.

QNTM, along with other technology companies, is working to mitigate the impact of the shortages by diversifying its supply chain and implementing contingency plans to minimize disruptions to its operations.

Industry analysts note that the shortages are a sector-wide issue, affecting multiple companies and product lines, rather than a QNTM-specific problem. The situation is being closely monitored by industry observers, with many expecting the shortages to continue into Q2 2023.

Quantum Compute Inc. (QNTM) has not issued a formal statement on the matter, but the company is expected to provide updates on its supply chain situation during its upcoming earnings call, scheduled for 14:00 EST on March 15, 2023.
